summary: The Parity Enforcement Act of 2025 aims to enforce mental health parity requirements in group health plans. It introduces civil monetary penalties for violations related to mental health and substance use disorder benefits. The bill amends the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 to include service providers and plan administrators as potential targets for penalties. It also clarifies enforcement exceptions and sets an effective date for the changes, applying to plan years beginning one year after enactment.
